courseDescription:
Microsoft Excel is a powerful and helpful program used to save and analyze numerical data. It is a spreadsheet program that contains several columns and rows. There are various editing methods and formatting techniques that you can do on an Excel spreadsheet. This course will discuss some handy tricks found in Excel to make your day-to-day work easier and faster. An exciting aspect of this course is that you will not need to memorize any complex formulas or make overly detailed notes to learn these tricks.

We begin by viewing the first video tutorial, where you will automatically fill data into selected cells. Then we explore the process of data linking between different spreadsheets and discover how to freeze a specific part of the Excel spreadsheet. This tool is a beneficial technique to keep your headline visible while you scroll down the sheet or to the right. As you move through the course, you will learn how to create data conditioning and a dropdown list to select any entry from predefined options. By viewing the easy-to-understand videos, you will learn how to extract valuable data from tangled and very complex data. However, what if Excel gives you an error in your document? This course covers a variety of solutions to these error issues.

Towards the end of the course, we demonstrate creating a simple account sheet that will be worthwhile and useful to help maintain records of income and expenses. The video tutorial will outline the first steps in performing this technique. Anyone interested in entering or learning more about Microsoft Excel will profit greatly from this course. You will be able to create and expertly manoeuvre around all the different sheets viewed in the course. Maintaining your data, whether it is financial, employee records or simply day-to-day information, is made easy. Start this course now and become a master of Microsoft Excel!
